{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3548126,"name":"Cole Shumaker","username":"c.shu","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/c.shu/{size}/136963_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T13:07:23.955Z","cooked":"

Hi all,

First off, I’m not a programmer and only know a little about the wiring. But our students don’t really browse CD and we are in need of some insight.

We are running MAX Swerve for the first time this year and we are struggling with getting it up and running.

The issue we are experiencing is that 2 of our drive wheels on opposite corners will run fine, but the other two need to be “jump started” to start moving. It just take a light tap on the wheel for it to start going. What could be the cause of this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T13:07:23.955Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":27.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494335,"topic_slug":"swerve-help-motors-need-kickstart-to-drive","display_username":"Cole Shumaker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17731,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9237 - Lead Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-help-motors-need-kickstart-to-drive/494335/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548129,"name":"Ben Edwards","username":"beedward","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beedward/{size}/111315_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T13:10:09.554Z","cooked":"

Check the connection of the 3 phase wires between the motor and the Spark Max on the offending wheels. I’ll be willing to bet you that one of them is loose or disconnected.

Seconding this. We had the same issue at the beginning of the year and this was the root cause

This probably goes without saying, but if that’s the issue, checking all four corners is a good use of time and preparation for the competition.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T13:34:25.731Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":16.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494335,"topic_slug":"swerve-help-motors-need-kickstart-to-drive","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-help-motors-need-kickstart-to-drive/494335/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548315,"name":"Josh","username":"AegisNova","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aegisnova/{size}/265035_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T16:35:00.298Z","cooked":"

We just checked this out last week. Try tethering the sparkmax and try running the motor normally, if it still needs a bump start, then swap the spark to a new one and test.

If the motor still needs a bump:
Then test the iffy spark with other motors, and if the bump is still needed, then you know the spark is bad.

If not:
I’d double check all the wires like @beedward said

Are you using PID to control wheel velocity or percent output? You could increase the P gain to see if you’re just not giving the wheels enough power (the two working could just have slightly lower friction)

We’ve actually had this issue twice, for two different reasons.
The first time it was disconnected wiring, the second time it was a bad SparkMax. Check both and see if that fixes things.
